intro: Clidemia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Clidemia donnell-smithii is considered an important component of the unique Hawaiian flora and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
